website_summaries.verdict: Designed to whiten teeth and improve gum health in a short period of time, this Sonicare toothbrush is pricey, but many find it worth it.
pros: This toothbrush comes with handy extras like a charging glass, charging base, charging travel case, and extra heads
cons: The "extras" drive up the price, which some consumers won't like

customer_reviews.title: Absolute piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: My family had two of these toothbrushes. We really liked them but both broke now within 4 weeks and after the warranty had expired ( in one case 6 weeks later, the other 7 months). The first toothbrush went crazy. It randomly started turning on, mostly during the night, sometimes 3 or 4 times. Also, the usage between charges got shorter and shorter. Finally, it stopped charging all together. The second brush simply fell apart while brushing. The metal rod where the brush head attaches came loose and the thing fell apart. Phillips didn't care and in both cases told us to go away and buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Joe

customer_reviews.title: Normally a great product, but this one is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after three months. Normally a great product, but this one is terrible. I tried to return it, but got no answer from Amazon or the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Cobbs

customer_reviews.title: It's a great toothbrush but has stopped working a number of times.  I've had to purchase this toothbrush 3 times.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time I purchased this toothbrush since each one has stopped working after about 2 years (after the warranty period expired). When the toothbrush works, it's one of the best looking and working electric toothbrushes you can buy. But for some reason, Philips did not do a good job in making it last longer. In between the two-year warranty period, I have had the toothbrush replaced at least 3 times. I wish it would last longer, but I keep on buying it since it keeps my teeth very clean. Just something to keep in mind when buying this toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Y.

customer_reviews.title: Will not last long, very bad quality!
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush is totally overpriced for the quality it offers. I have had it for less than 20 months and all of a sudden it totally blocked and stopped working .No luck with customer service whom I contacted to kindly just sell me a new handle, in order not to contribute to more garbage on this planet, by having to throw away glass, case, and brush-heads. But they obviously produce their goods to be thrown away after 12 months max.Definitely not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: U. Meiner

customer_reviews.title: Googling this problem made it clear that this is pretty common with the unit which is very surpring for ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this toothbrush! I bought mine 10 months ago and it no longer works. The unit will power on, but has stopped vibrating. Googling this problem made it clear that this is pretty common with the unit which is very surpring for the price point. I'd suggest going with the Oral-B Pro 7000 linked below. I wish I would have researched more before buying.
customer_reviews.author: detsl

customer_reviews.title: Great for a year or two
customer_reviews.text: Was great at first, but stopped charging and working after two years. Guess warranty isn’t for a lifetime. I enjoyed using the toothbrush but the brushheads can be pricey so would buy off brand heads and they never fit right. Also I had the pink one and the travel case stains easily and is impossible to clean. Won’t rebuy cause of the price and warranty situation. Disappointing. Worth more like $50 in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Chelly

customer_reviews.title: Best Philips Sonicare!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Philips Sonicare for years now and this new improved Diamond Clean is terrific. So many settings to get different variation on clean and the water glass included as the base charger is ingenious. Also the rechargeable travel case is amazing. Great innovations which makes Philips Sonicare the best on the market. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tipitina

customer_reviews.title: stop working properly after 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product since December 2017. The toothbrush worked very well for about 2 years. Then the strength of the program started to reduce. Each program now goes "on mute" several times during each program. I have called the Philips Sonicare several teams. First time, I was walked through the troubleshooting. The call lasted about 5 min but the agent didn't record my call. I called back again 2 weeks later, and there were no trace of the incident . The agent didn't believe me and told me that anyway my toothbrush was not under warranty anyway and she was doing me a favor.
customer_reviews.author: The Belgianize

customer_reviews.title: Please fix this issue!
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great toothbrush, however I have had two now and both of them become increasingly hard to turn on. The power button design is faulty to the point that I have to use both hands to turn it on and off and no way can you process through the different options. For the price I am very disappointed that the company hasn't fixed this problem. Many people are having this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Skye

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working a few months after warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Started having problems after one year - sudden stop, have to press the button multiple times to start, less durable after each charge. I think it's probably because of leaking. Sometimes it wouldn't start and I had to shake it and used a cloth to clean the water coming out of the button and then it might start. Complete stopped working 1moth ago which was after two and half years. Warranty expired after two years. At that time, I could use it just for 5 or 6 days after each charge. I bought it for $130 after a discount. So, it's $50/year. Not worth it. Bought a cheaper Sonicare for $70. Hopefully, it'll last for more than 2 yrs.
customer_reviews.author: ice_e

customer_reviews.title: won’t last
customer_reviews.text: was great until it just stopped working after 2 years. philips wouldn’t do anything bc they have a 2 year warranty. had it for about 2.5 years. really disappointing. that’s a lot of money to spend every 2 years plus heads. will buy a cheaper one this time. save your money if you want it to last longer than 2 years
customer_reviews.author: amazonloverfromtn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Results Every Time
customer_reviews.text: This is the best electric toothbrush I have ever had. I upgraded from an Oral-B spinbrush and the first time I used the sonicare I realized what I had been missing! The brush is easy to use and looks elegant in its stand so you don't have to worry about people seeing it by the sink. Every time I use the brush I feel like I just left the dentist. My dentist always comments on how clean and healthy my teeth and gums are on every visit. This product is definitely not cheap, but is worth every penny for someone who wants to avoid cavities and dentures one day!
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Unlike any other brush I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about buying this due to the price. The purchase was purely accidental. I was holding my iPad and inadvertently hit the buy with on click button. I didn't know I did so until I got my order confirmation email. I tried to cancel my order but it was too late! Boy am I glad I didn't cancel the order. I love this brush. I've had electric toothbrushes before but not like this one. I felt like I had just left the dentist after the first use. This brush is well worth the money. If you're on the fence push the buy button, you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: MK in MI

customer_reviews.title: Slow death after 4 yrs of service
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised that the unit is now barley working as previous models (less expense) worked forever and replaced them due to I wanted the best product to clean my teeth so I do agree with others sentiment as to you pay $200+ and this should ether last or Phillips should fix it. I wont be buying any Phillips products again remember that Phillips when you make a business decision to not cover your product and you end up losing a great customer, who lost here you or me?
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toothbrush when it works
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toothbrush when it works, and up until this week, I had no complaints. But this week it stopped working. First it appeared that the battery was dead, then it would come on intermittently but then stop, and then it stopped working altogether. The warranty is two years. I've had it two years and 8 months. According to Philips' support page, the battery on this model can't be replaced, so I'm now out of luck. In my opinion, that's too short a life for a toothbrush that costs $200.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Neil

customer_reviews.title: its the best of the best
customer_reviews.text: its the best of the best. I just wish sonic care would have gone with a more traditional charging base. I am never going to use that cup to drink from, espesily when its out in the open all the time and I use it to leave my tooth brush in. kinda gimmicky if you ask me. I would have rather they just made a stand for it to keep the brush vertical. as it is now i feel like i can easily knock the whole thing over if i wasn't careful. still though, as far as the over all function of the tooth brush you cant beat it. your mouth will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: SlowDive3030

customer_reviews.title: This is very annoying as the unit has to be on to change ...
customer_reviews.text: You can not lock in your power setting. This is very annoying as the unit has to be on to change the settings, spraying water and tooth paste while making the change.
customer_reviews.author: H Lee Helfer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband. After 6 months it broke. He wrote Phillips, they had him mail it to them, then sent him a replacement. It worked well for 2 years. The next 2 years were hit or miss. It worked about 50% of the time. This last year, it worked about 20% of the time until it completely quit yesterday. With a $190 price tag, I expect something like this to WORK and last longer. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christine C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you want a new way to get rid of your money.
customer_reviews.text: I dont mind paying extra to clean my teeth. This toothbrush, I loved it at first. Hawked it to all my friends about the amazing clean and all that. Then it broke. Pretty bummed. Got it replaced under warranty, then the replacement broke again in 3 days. Super nice if you want to pay a premium for garbage. Both of the handles I have now do nothing but make a high pitched wine when I try to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Nick N.

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: Really bummed to report this time around that like others, this device failed to hold a charge within literal weeks of it being out of warranty. The one I had previous to this and it lasted over 5 years with no issue. This one lasted 2 years. I don’t know if I will order again bc I can’t deny that using this toothbrush has changed my dental health around 180. But the price and to have the last one last 2 years? Not to mention the cost of replacement heads. It’s just a tough call.
customer_reviews.author: scsmiles99

customer_reviews.title: Great until it breaks one year later
customer_reviews.text: It started as a very good brush, immediately saw a difference, I loved the convenience of the charging cup. However, the rod supporting the head broke after a year's use, the head would wobble all over and make loud noises. Customer service replaced with a new brush, which broke exactly one year later... I contacted customer service again but this time, they told me the warranty had expired and they would give me a 20% discount on a new brush purchased on their site. For a $200+ product, it's 1 year life is unacceptable. I won't be buying Sonicare again.
customer_reviews.author: NYMX

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple weeks and now it's very loud even after changing. This is my second Sonicare Diamond toothbrush and my first one lasted well over two years, but this one has been very disappointing. This product is marketed as being one of the more quiet toothbrushes, however this doesn't seem to be the case. It works great and looks good, but it definitely is not quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Schae

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at first...then it died
customer_reviews.text: First off I will say that this unit did a pretty good job when I first got it. The dentist recommended it and and my hygienist even said that I was doing a good job cleaning my teeth at my next visit. Then one day. I took it out of the charging glass,, and then nothing.. Of course this happened after the warranty period was over.. Maybe I'll try Oral-B next time,, as I will never buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn T. Banks

customer_reviews.title: Great clean, short life
customer_reviews.text: This is a great brush and really good for the gums. I purchased two as I live overseas. But both stopped charging this year. First one stopped charging in January, then the second one started erratically starting and stopping at random times. It vibrated itself right off the table and fell on floor. While they worked though they were so good. I’m considering buying a new one but wonder if the charging is still an issue with new models.
customer_reviews.author: Ezekiel

customer_reviews.title: Two Year Warranty-Product fails in 2 years and 4 months
customer_reviews.text: When this product works I really like it. We have had 3 in our home. Problem is it comes with a 2 year warranty and they seem to die (not recharge, not work, not apply right pressure) about 2 years and 3-6 months after we get them. So I would look at this a an item that will need to be replaced every 2 years even with light use. I'm switching to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Eye MD KC

customer_reviews.title: Where is the vibration?
customer_reviews.text: Works well when it works. I had two of these units over time. I had to replace all of them within warranty for various reasons. One stopped working after two years - it makes the buzzing sound but the vibration it provides is at least 75% less and it does not vibrate at all depending on the pressure applied to the head when brushing. Looking for alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: SStep

customer_reviews.title: Still love this toothbrush over two years later--actually it may be ...
customer_reviews.text: Still love this toothbrush over two years later--actually it may be three years! Still beautiful purple and holds a charge for weeks if I have it in the other bathroom without the charger. I like the choice of brushing modes for when I need a different kind of cleaning. I also prefer the regular white brush heads, which fit this model, are less expensive, and work better than the black Diamond heads.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Tickles at first, but you'll get used to it.
customer_reviews.text: I tried an Oral B some years ago and it didn't stop the plaque build-up in recessed areas of my teeth. I've had this for a few months. I got it right after a cleaning, when the hygienist recommended it, and my teeth look like they did they day I left the dentist office. Could not be happier. The case is nice (I travel quite a bit), the charge lasts a long time and the replaceable brush part is lasting quite a while, too. And the purple finish looks and feels nice. A quality piece.
customer_reviews.author: Rhinoboy

customer_reviews.title: Easily breaks
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second Philips Sonicare Diamond Clean Rechargeable Toothbrush in the last year and half, both times the toothbrush stopped charging. It would turn on in the middle of the day and start vibrating, each day I would turn it off, and then one day it ran out of battery and completely stopped charging. For such an expense the quality should be far higher. I won't buy again, I highly suggest buying the protection if you do buy this, but for over $200.00 you really shouldn't need to pay extra for protection within just one, even two years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Brielle

customer_reviews.title: No more charge
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tooth brush back in April 2017 & loved how it worked. It died this week and will not recharge. I was going to just buy a new one but I can't believe how much of a price increase it has had in a little over a year. I am disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl-Ann Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Toothbrush failed after 24 months, but Philips will send me a new one.
customer_reviews.text: Almost 2 years to the day, this toothbrush stopped working. It was an expensive toothbrush. The warranty expires after 24 months, but if you remember to register online, you will get an additional 6 months of coverage for no extra fee. I contacted Philips, and they agreed to send me a new one (a one time only situation). I am happy they will send a new one, but would love for companies like Philips to make a better quality product that doesn't fail after 2 years. Our landfills are full enough!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sall

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT LAST! STOPPED working for no reason!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to warranty I got replace this broken one with a new one, the second also worked only a year and half!!!!!!!! UPDATED review 1 star I bought this item on September 14, 2015 and was taking good care of it, it stopped working yesterday for no reason! I can tell that charger is working, but toothbrush simple doesn't work.! OLD review 5 stars I think it is the best toothbrush on market! It is much much better than my previous Oral-B one and of course more expensive! but since you brushing your teeth every day twice, please consider how important to have a good toothbrush and this one definitely what you need
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea that it can be charged USB - HATE THE EXCESSIVE VIBRATION
customer_reviews.text: Well - I had a Sonicare for ages. I thought it would be great to get one that charges via USB because I travel so much. The carrying case is fantastic. BUT this thing vibrates and no it's not the toothbrush vibration you're used to. It's that annoying vibration you get on your current Sonicare when the head isn't entirely attached to the wand. It's just really irritating - the sound/feeling of it. There's no fix from what I can figure out. There are YouTube fixes for this but honestly at $200+ dollars fix it!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca E. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: i love this thing. never going back to manual
customer_reviews.text: love this. ill never go back to regular tooth brushes. I've used HX6731/02 and it works just as good. If you don't need the holding class and the carrying case save your money. I only use the clean option and the polish sometime if i want a quick clean up before i go out because it brushes for a shorter time. The class and the case charge it which is really convenient and cool I love the fact its black also but like i said if you don't care about color or the charging glass and case save your money and get the HX6731/02. They all brush the same.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Only downside is there is only one ...
customer_reviews.text: Last Sonicare was from nine years ago and was the top of the line model. This one was to replace it but the charging system is different. This one has the charging travel case so it's much more convenient for those of us on the go. Great product. Only downside is there is only one button now for On/Off and mode selection whereas the old brush had two buttons. Progress isn't always better but materials used are better. Hope it lasts me for another nine years.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Y

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in slightly under 3 years
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush suddenly stopped working. It just won't turn on. The newer colored Phillips Sonicare Diamond Clean, I wonder if they are just candy that costs a lot but delivers little. I mean, how could a toothbrush that costs nearly $200 pack up without any warning!
customer_reviews.author: TSR

customer_reviews.title: A toothbrush made for people with ADHD 😉
customer_reviews.text: Love this toothbrush! Making brushing so MUCH easier, my mouth feels SUPER clean. I personally find the timer a really helpful feature. I know before this toothbrush I definitely wasn't making it through the full 2 minutes I was supposed to be doing. As well, since it buzzes between the 4 quadrants of your mouth I find that really helpful to ensure I spend 30 seconds on each quadrant. (Which the instructions indicate how to use) I really like the travel case and haven't had any problems with the cup charger and I've owned this for over 2 years. The travel case is quite convenient. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 years' use. Not durable as it supposed to be
customer_reviews.text: After using 3 years, this $200 toothbrush was died, neither able to be recharged properly nor powerful while using as before. Please think about your budget for a 3-year-long electric toothbrush before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty design guaranteed to fail in 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: A great toothbrush with a major fault. It *will* fail in almost exactly 1.5 years. First one failed in 1.5 years, had it replaced. Second one is now failing with the exact same symptoms after, you guessed it, 1.5 years (this time no warranty for replacement). The rod connecting to the vibration motor gets looser and looser until eventually the motor doesn't vibrate the toothbrush at all. Better off buying a cheap sonicare toothbrush (the internals are essentially identical anyways) if it is going to fail this quickly. I thought buying a high quality sonicare toothbrush meant that I could have something to last me a long time, but I was sorely mistaken.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Meyer

customer_reviews.title: This does NOT last don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Just shy of the two year warranty (assuming that’s the timeframe) my toothbrush now doesn’t work at all, it will not charge and has absolutely no movement (I have another which charges so I know it’s not the charging station). Extremely dissatisfied and wouldn’t recommend, such an expensive product and can’t even last 2.5 years! I have bought earlier models and while they also didn’t last as long as one would hope for the price, they lasted longer than this.
customer_reviews.author: Hana Ransom

customer_reviews.title: Works for a year, than the battery dies.
customer_reviews.text: Battery dies after a year. Bought cheaper Oral B instead, and the hygienist was happy from the ORAL B performance, too. The battery replacement: most of them get 3 stars in the review, so maybe it's not worth to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years, Dead, Warranty Expired.
customer_reviews.text: It really does clean your teeth well. I kept great care of it. I replaced the heads every 2-3 months... today I was brushing my teeth the motor became quite loud and then stopped working. I charged it fully just to be sure and contacted Philips Sonicare. Support said "sorry you need to replace the toothbrush". they offered 20% off of their site which are all retail price. It seems like a lot of money to spend every few years to keep a working Philips Sonicare. I might look at another brand that is cheaper and lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Sillihkram

customer_reviews.title: TOOTHBRUSH STOPPED WORKING AFTER 2 YEARS
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the performance of the toothbrush. I purchased it on June 27, 2017. However, about a week ago, it started operating itself. It would turn on and off while just sitting in the bathroom. Yesterday, it completely quit working. I tried charging it, and it's just completely fried. $200 for 2 years isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paige H.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of dropping; it won't withstand the fall.
customer_reviews.text: We had this toothbrush for a little over 1 year. I accidentally dropped it a distance of 2 feet to the floor. It slipped from my hand somehow. It stopped working & it seems kaput. One fall of a short distance & it's done. I would think that for the price of this toothbrush it should be built to withstand a fairly normal fall. Think twice before spending so much money on a toothbrush that can't withstand a minor fall from your hand. Until this happened, it worked great. We expected a better quality build. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pollock

customer_reviews.title: Timed to die after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I do like the product. However, I bought my first unit on May 13 2012 and it died after 3 years (the manufacture warranty expire after 2 years.) I gave it the benefit of the doubt, and I bought a replacement unit on April 10, 2015. That also died last week, after 3 years. I contacted Philips Sonicar customer server to find out why both units all of a sudden started going off on their own randomly to the point that the battery would be drained and couldn't be recharged. They had no explanation for that, and quickly pointed out that the 2-year warranty had expired.
customer_reviews.author: Kaltig

customer_reviews.title: Broke after almost exactly 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Update: two years later (almost to the date) when toothbrush would be turned it vibrated extremely loud. So loud that it's impossible to use. Sounds like its going to blow up up. Ridiculous. previous Phillip's toothbrush lasted 5 years. I was expecting this one to also. My husband and I use these. They are fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.author: March

customer_reviews.title: Can not say anything negative about this product!
customer_reviews.text: This product speaks for itself! I have had this for a month and am completely happy with it. I love how it is charged I have only charged it one since I got it. I use the whitening and gum settings. Those two are my favorite. I sometimes when I wake up late for class just brush my teeth in the shower so I love that I do not have to worry about water getting into weird places that can cause mold or any weird gunk. It is smooth and I love my toothbrush. I brush my teeth religiously 3-4 times a day so dental hygiene means a lot to me.
customer_reviews.author: CollegeRunner

customer_reviews.title: Best electronic brush by far
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several electronic toothbrushes and the DiamondClean is the best that I've ever used. There are several settings for different uses, but I generally do not use them. I specifically want the deep clean of the brush and it works great! I travel a lot and take the brush everywhere and never worry about the charge not holding even when traveling on a week-long trip. Even if you need to charge on the road, the brush comes with a charge cord that connects to the travel case, which is a great convenience. Even if my brush was to break, I would repurchase this device again. My family and I all have one.
customer_reviews.author: Beckum MD

customer_reviews.title: Recently upgraded from the flexcare. Brush feels more solid ...
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded from the flexcare. Brush feels more solid in your hand and doesn't stop vibrating when you push the brush head in to your teeth. I have a tendency to do that and it stops other models from working. Big fan of the glass cup charger. Be sure to get white because other colors will show the slightest amount of toothpaste residue. I didn't consider it either but heard it was an issue and decided against the black model.
customer_reviews.author: RZ

customer_reviews.title: Far overpriced, while it demonstrates lower plaque removal efficacy in clinical research
customer_reviews.text: You can get much better plaque removal efficacy in clinical trials with oral-b. It doesn't need to be so over-priced, when its design is inferior to the best dental products on the market. For one thing, clinicians found that it doesn't force fluid between the gums as advertised because of fluid viscosity. If you want to force fluid between your gums, get a Water Piq. You could buy one, and an oral-b together for less. The replacement brush heads for this toothbrush are also much more expensive than oral-b. Noticing a theme here?
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Highly, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a number of Sonicare toothbrush models and this model is BY FAR the best yet! The slimmer, sleek design is good-looking and the rechargeable base actually looks nice sitting out on the bathroom counter. I can go just about 3 weeks without needing to recharge, however. The travel case and USB charger make traveling with this super convenient and easy. This pretty little toothbrush does the most amazing job cleaning AND whitening teeth! My smile was noticeably brighter/whiter after only 1-2 weeks of daily use and it feels like I got a professional cleaning after each use. Highly, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great price compared to everyone else
customer_reviews.text: Great price compared to everyone else. Works well. Be careful not to drop or you'll ruin the cosmetic outside coating. It holds a charge. I like that it has sensitive--the most important selection for delicate teeth w dental work. Use the appropriate brush head because it makes a world of difference--actually gets it very clean when you use the diamond head. I noticed the Diamond Head brush replacement worked on my older handle (flexcare) and cleaned my teeth very well. This comes with a couple of replacement heads and has a nice case for recharging.
customer_reviews.author: Paperie

customer_reviews.title: vibration stopped after a few years
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a few years, but the vibration got really weak recently and now it only vibrates for 20-30 seconds if I tap it against the countertop. Check out youtube for repair videos, turns out the magnet moves over time and just needs a little gap added (where the screw driver is in this photo), took me about 15 min to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Widmann

customer_reviews.title: I have had two of these Philips Sonicare DiamondClean rechargeable ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these Philips Sonicare DiamondClean rechargeable toothbrushes. Both of them, and I paid WELL over $100.00 for each, lasted about 1 year. They started going haywire first with the power button. It sticks and it took the pressure of BOTH thumbs to turn it on/off. Then, when I was in the middle of brushing on the "white" mode, it would all of a sudden stop for no reason. It was fully charged. Then it stopped holding a charge. I am DONE with this brand of toothbrush and am now shopping and researching other brands.
customer_reviews.author: diamond girl

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this electric toothbrush because I liked that I could easily wash and keep the charging cup clean. Sadly this toothbrush stopped working after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but will only last you about a year
customer_reviews.text: Great, but will only last you about a year, would be ok if it was cheaper, but not worth 180 if its only going to last a year.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Makes my dental cleanings go a whole lot faster!
customer_reviews.text: So I must say that I thought I might be crazy for spending what I spent on this just to have a pink one, but I'm over that. I love my Sonicare, and my dental hygienist does too. My cleanings have been much less scraping of tartar since using this - I've had it for almost 2 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Gwenifer

customer_reviews.title: Stunning 25th Century Black Ceramic Toothbrush. Two Thumbs Up!
customer_reviews.text: I am the proud owner of the most beautiful and amazing black ceramic toothbrush that magically charges inside a heavy glass bathroom tumbler and inside a sleek magical travel case. I have used Sonicare since 2001 when it first came out and a dentist recommended it because I was a lazy flosser and my gums were receding. Years later, healthy gums and teeth. This Dr Who-ish manifestation far exceeds previous generations of the Sonicare. Must be technology borrowed from the aliens at Area 51 or the Underground Bunker. Bravo, Philips!
customer_reviews.author: Irving Sambolin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought and received this toothbrush earlier this month (January 4th), but I am really enjoying it so far. I have found the DiamondClean toothbrush really easy to use and I think my teeth feel cleaner because I have started using this brush (it's like going to the dentist without leaving the house!). I like the flexibility of having the charging glass and I also like how the battery lasts a significant amount of time. I have not yet used the travel charger (but I am going on a trip in the near future and will report back on its ease of use). So far, I am thrilled with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Love this tooth brush. My Husband had one and I decided to order one for myself considering how much he talked about it. I have to say I now love it to. It definitely seems to clean much better then a regular tooth brush.The timer, case, and other features come in handy especially when traveling. Wish it cost a bit less, but overall satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: NytaTop Contributor: Architecture

customer_reviews.title: Quality doesn’t live up to cost
customer_reviews.text: Don’t spend the money. Mine is two years old, and has stopped working. This brush cleans like any other toothbrush, and has lots of features that make it annoying to use. Electric toothbrushes are great, but for the two years I used this one, I never understood why the cost was so high.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Register your product!
customer_reviews.text: Snazzy appearance, but the brush started splaying out within a few days. Selecting from cleaning modes is annoying. I miss my old Sonicare. ***UPDATE*** July 5, 2016 A few months ago, the brush began to perform poorly (brushing wasn't as intense). Tonight it wouldn't turn on, even though I recharged it three days ago. I think I'm going back to a regular toothbrush for a while. My Sonicares don't last me very long. ***UPDATE JULY 6, 2016*** Good thing I registered! I was barely covered by the warranty, and will receive a new handle. I think I initially received a lemon since the charge never lasted more than a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Junksupposed

customer_reviews.title: From a dental assistant, this is the best toothbrush! :)
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this toothbrush. The many different options it has, whitening option definitely whitens. I can see and feel the difference between a manual toothbrush and this electric toothbrush. I am a dental assistant and this is one of the highly recommended electric toothbrushes. Oral B is also recommended...the difference really is user preference...if you like circular motion get oral B, if you like vibration up and down motion get sonicare. Personally, I think Sonicare is the best!
customer_reviews.author: StephJayde

customer_reviews.title: an investment for your future!
customer_reviews.text: love this brush so much! first off, it looks awesome on your counter with the black color and wizard like glass charging cup. i actually had to go for a deep cleaning and my hygienist recommended this. didn't really want to spend the money, but didn't want to go through the torture of another deep cleaning, so i tried it out. a month later with twice daily usage and flossing, i noticed a substantial difference and feel, keeping up with my deep cleaning. worth the money especially when it comes to something that really prevents oral disease. being in the medical field, something so simple as maintaining oral health goes a long way for the future, i promise!
customer_reviews.author: hellothere1251

customer_reviews.title: Clean teeth, fresh mouth
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Toothbrush, with the very best results. Unfortunately it died on me in March 2018. I am the only person using this toothbrush, the toothbrush was never dropped, the handle never immersed in water in fact it still looks brand new, so does my charging glass and my charging base, and my charging case is still in the plastic sleeve it originally came in. So sad, cannot afford another one.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte Strong

customer_reviews.title: Broken within 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Just stopped working couple months ago (literally a year and half mark), not sure the seller will do anything about it, for the price I would not purchase this again
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie

customer_reviews.title: Superb brush, effective life of 4 years
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been using this toothbrush (one each) for 6-8 years and finding it has a lifetime of about 2 years. Then issues occur that make it unusable; doesn't hold charge, doesn't vibrate, doesn't turn on, etc. Customer service is excellent and may correct the issue and will eventually replace the brush under warranty, so the effective life of the brush is about 4 years. The performance if the brush is superb, have never had better checkups at the dentist.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: They keep breaking
customer_reviews.text: Disaster! We already have our third toothbrush and this one broke again. Does Philips have something called quality control?
customer_reviews.author: Shlomo Doegenstein

customer_reviews.title: When your hygienist notices....
customer_reviews.text: Honestly when the first question your dental hygienist asks is "do you use a Sonicare?", it's worth the money in my opinion. If a professional not only notices how clean your teeth are but recognizes the tool that got them that clean it must be an industry standard. This particular model is not only good looking but practical. The provided glass doubles as a charging base. Looks very clean on my counter. The travel case also doubles as a charger. If you've never used a Sonicare you won't be disappointed with its results. Feels like you've just left the dentist after a cleaning. But you get that feeling every day. Completely worth the price. My dentist agrees.
customer_reviews.author: TeeJay

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be warned - dies when warranty ends
customer_reviews.text: I loved this toothbrush, it worked fantastic, had tons of options, and made my teeth feel super clean AND THEN as lots of buyers have warned right about when I had it for two years and the warranty ended, so did the toothbrush. Philips customer care had me try all sorts of things to get it to work but in the end they will not repair or replace them and I was toothbrush less and out a couple hundred dollars. A mild annoyance is the travel case is not easy to clean and can become gross is you use it for long trips. Overall: Not worth the investment. Do not buy - save your money and time!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Gammell

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 4 yrs. then died without warning.
customer_reviews.text: This brush worked well for about 4 years, delivering great performance during cleanings, as expected, before suddenly dying. I always kept it clean, it was never handled roughly, and I replaced brush heads regularly as they wore out. I was very disappointed when the brush died based on how much I paid for it originally and I discovered it is outside of the warranty period. I’ve been a loyal Sonicare user for 15+ years, but it seems they are continually increasing in price and decreasing in quality/longevity.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sensitive teeth
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush has done wonders for my teeth. After a few weeks of using it (and brushing twice a day), I've noticed that I have less sensitivity, my teeth are whiter, and my mouth feels much cleaner after brushing. I love the glass charging station, not that I have to use it often because this toothbrush holds a charge for a long time! It travels well too, which is a definite plus. Sure, the brush heads are expensive, but for the kind of clean you're getting, they're well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Molly W.

customer_reviews.title: the brush randomly turns on itself.
customer_reviews.text: The brush is amazing! During 2 years I was enjoying this brush! But right after 2 years passed my brush went crazy, it started randomly turns on by itself and there is no option to turn it off completely. When I turn it off by pushing the button it turns On again. It really scary to wake up at night because the brush started vibrating. I had to wait until battery sit down and no I don't want to charge it again. Moreover, the brush's button is not waterproof, so toothpaste with water flows into the space between the button and the brush body. Because of that after some time it become difficult to press the button.
customer_reviews.author: Aliya

customer_reviews.title: Died at warranty expiration
customer_reviews.text: Just like everyone else is saying - 2 years in and it’s dead. $100 a year for a toothbrush is rather excessive. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: HAS5280

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush was great while it lasted - which was exactly 13 months. Now it won't charge, and they weren't very helpful about processing a return. I've never had a Sonicare last more than two years, so I guess I shouldn't be surprised. Time to try a rival brand.
customer_reviews.author: DogMaTX

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toothbrush with short life
customer_reviews.text: This probably is one the best toothbrushes on the market for cleaning. Unfortunately, it will stop working shortly after the 2-2 1/2 year warranty. My first DiamondClean toothbrush went a little after 2 years. Philips sent a replacement (under warranty) which lasted until yesterday (about 2.5 years). I also had purchased a DiamondClean toothbrush in 2016 that lasted about 2 1/2 years and stopped working. For the steep price tag, this toothbrush should last at least 5 years and not until after the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Hulk

customer_reviews.title: Terrible charging system
customer_reviews.text: The brush and travel kit are great. But the over complicated charger makes this so frustrating. You have your normal charger that can only be used with a glass sitting on top of it. And it’s large and the brush leans. This feels so awkward and takes up so much counter space and storage space. Not to mention if you break the glass your charger is useless. I feel like they sent me a European charger as well. I have to use an adaptor that came with to plug it into the wall. This is such a terrible system it makes you loose site on the quality of the actual brush.
customer_reviews.author: e

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: Although this toothbrush is a little pricey, it is worth the cost. Wireless charging makes charging the device very easy and convenient (Without any unnecessary hassle with wires) The different modes/settings that are available allow for versatility Comes with multiple heads, which serve many beneficial purposes The device comes with a very high-quality travel case, which makes taking this on the go very easy and efficient
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy!!! My review is not about the toothbrush itself, but about customer service support. My brush completely died last night--just past my two-year warranty. I was offered a 15% coupon on a new complete package--apparently they will not sell or replace the handle, which is all I need! I don't need a new charger set or brush heads. I will be sure to let my dentist know about this lousy customer support. Sorry Philips, but you failed here. I will NOT spend an additional $200 for everything when I don't need everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First of all I LOVE the color
customer_reviews.text: First of all I LOVE the color! Finally a product that's the proper color of purple! (Usually they only make things that are magenta and marketed as purple!!) Second, I love how it has so many optional settings and the glass charger is FANTASTIC!! I hated my old sonicare double head, sanitizing charger that took up so much room on the counter!! This one keeps things so much cleaner, too! I used to get a lot of water deposits on the old sanitizing charger...
customer_reviews.author: Meliss...

customer_reviews.title: Possessed Toothbrush of Doom
customer_reviews.text: Was great while it lasted - now, a $180 addition to the local landfill. It became unusable due to a known design flaw (Google it) where the unit will randomly power itself on at all hours of the day and night until the battery dies (which can take days - fun!). Not to mention it's about as quiet as a B2 bomber flying overhead at 1,000ft. We had to bury the tell-tale toothbrush under some blankets on the opposite side of the house to get any sleep (no joke). For $180, we deserve better. For $180, you could buy enough manual toothbrushes to last 45 years (do the math).
customer_reviews.author: Nirchi

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Last 100 plus dollar sonicare failed after 2 years. Went for it again cause they are the industry standard right? This top of the line $200 one, the brush head failed on me after 6 months, so I have to buy replacements. Ya, they say replace every 3 months for the bristles, but the bristles are just fine, its the attachment that failed. Not too big a deal, but the customer service sucks so bad that they get 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: poijhag4ongfdsa'f

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush until it stops working
customer_reviews.text: Great toothbrush until it stops working. How long should one of these last? I have had several diamonds and they seem to last 1.5 ~2yrs. for ~$200. It is a lot to fork out since other alt are coming onto the market. BTW if you stops working they are pretty egged on replacements it just another hassle.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Philips Sonicare HX9332/05 first in July 2015 , which broke a year later and I bought another one in May 2015, which again broke and I bought a final model in Oct 2016 this time with a 2.5 year warranty. Well, it held up until now (Sep 2019) and just stopped working this morning. Needless to say I will not purchase from Philips again.
customer_reviews.author: Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Loved this while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Loved this while it lasted. It died exactly two months after the warranty expired. It just stopped working. We had a second one that was maybe a year older that died the month prior. Both died the same death - fully charged, they just would not turn on anymore. Going to switch to Oral-B. They are a lot less money ($90), and they get similar reviews for how effective they are. Even if the Oral-B product does not last any longer we will at least be money ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Davis

customer_reviews.title: failed twice on me
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. Product failed one me twice already. I believe the battery died each time. First time it broke after less than 2 years of use. It was under warranty, so I got a replacement. Then, the replacement died a little after a year of use. These are faulty products that are designed to fail. You've been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Made for European market, not American
customer_reviews.text: Don't like that the product was made for the European market with an adapter on the end of the plug that converts it to US style. I will be cutting off the European plug and replace it with the US style plug.
customer_reviews.author: andyho

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tooth brush
customer_reviews.text: Comes with 3 different brush heads and has different settings for the ultimate clean. My teeth have stayed pearly white much longer that I am using teeth whiteners less. I always have the glossy feel like going into the dentist for a cleaning. I bought my son his own after his braces came off and the deep clean setting erased his yellow teeth.
customer_reviews.author: adabelr

customer_reviews.title: Battery issue
customer_reviews.text: I know I bought this brush long long ago before I give my review, the reason I wanted to write it because the battery is not last long now, I have to charge it every day, it is time that I buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Simplly amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am sure some of the less expensive Sonicare systems would work just as well but having the wireless recharge ability and very nice case makes it well worth the investment if you travel alot like I do. Plus you can use any of the Sonicare replacement toothbrush heads. I bought a 12 pack from Sam's Club so I will be good for the next 2 yrs :)
customer_reviews.author: Steve_o19

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Like many Amazon purchases, I never envisioned I would be writing a review on this type of item. However, this really is a fantastic product. My teeth definitely feel cleaner using this vs. an older E-series sonic care I had had for many years. The charging glass is a neat novelty as well as the travel case, but I also don't really need to use either one personally. I would absolutely recommend this product to someone looking to buy a new soniccare.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Clean teeth!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice toothbrush. The smaller brush will take some getting use to. Plus don’t turn it on until it’s in your mouth or you’ll keep losing your toothpaste in the sink lol. My teeth feel and look cleaner/whiter after just a few uses. Wish the price was lower... I saw some at a local store after I purchased this one, that were priced 2 for the price of this one. Maybe because the color I’m not sure. Recieved it quick and packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective product and poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: I believe that I got a bad product. Most people that have this are very pleased with it. Mine never held a charge for more than a few days and after a few months, wouldn't charge at all. I have contacted Philips about the situation 4 times over the past month. They keep asking me to send the purchase receipt - which I do - and they still have not resolved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: PNC

customer_reviews.title: Great gift and deep clean! Your Dentist will thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, my boss actually bought me one for Christmas (I like practical gifts what can I say) and then I bought this one for my mother. Our shared dentist is always so impressed with how clean our teeth are. The travel case is a nice touch, and I want to get one for myself for longer trips.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Get one!
customer_reviews.text: My hygienist at the periodontist recommended this toothbrush. I am so glad I got one. After going through oral surgery and deep cleanings, I had my first great report from the periodontist today. I have no more periodontal disease! My gums are in great shape!!! And I've only been using it for 3 months on the sensitive setting. Do yourself a favor and get one. It's worth the price to save on dental bills and have a healthy mouth.
customer_reviews.author: MINDY BYINGTON

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality, Have Had 2 Break After A Year
customer_reviews.text: These are poorly constructed and break easily. I have had 2 of theses break after about a year, the metal part that vibrates came loose on both. Did get replacements but I am now out of the 2 year warranty window and have to buy new ones. Would not recommend spending money on these before they fix the construction issues.
customer_reviews.author: T. C.

customer_reviews.title: If you want THE BEST care for your teeth, then go ahead and get this and feel good about it
customer_reviews.text: This is very expensive, but I have to honestly say I love it. It really gets your teeth clean. My dentist hygienist cannot believe how great my teeth look since I purchased this brush. There is an internal timer that buzzes in your mouth when it's time to rotate the brush to another quadrant in your mouth. It ensures you spend enough time on each area of you mouth. The brushes are awesome and it comes in a great travel kit with chargers and all. If you can afford it, this thing is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: SCOOP

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING Product!
customer_reviews.text: I am simply in love with this product. My dentist informed my that my gums looked poor during a dental exam and cleaning and recommend that I get this brush. During my last exam my dentist committed that the difference was night and day. I am particularly thankful for the built in timer that reminds me to continue brushing as well as the auto pause when I am becoming to aggressive. I love this Sonicare and recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: This is our second time that the product we purchased is defective. The first time we received it, the main unit would not charge. On the second order, the charging glass plate was entirely missing! I don't have the time (waited in line to return it at Kohl's for 45 minutes) for the lack of quality control which apparently doesn't exist. It is difficult to review the product without it even being operational. I really want the pink brush but I am reluctant to order from this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this toothbrush and my teeth have never felt so ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an electric toothbrush look no further. I love this toothbrush and my teeth have never felt so clean. The white mode really does whiten your teeth in two weeks. I have really sensitive teeth and the "sensitive" mode is gently enough and thoroughly cleans.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Elise Chase

product_meta.title: Philips Sonicare DiamondClean rechargeable electric toothbrush, White Edition, HX9332
feature_bullets: The most loved electric toothbrush brand by Americans and their dentists
Removes 100 percent more plaque than a manual toothbrush in hard to reach areas; Includes 2 DiamondClean brush heads
Whitens teeth in just 1 week, Healther gums in only 2 weeks

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
